"Prisoner of Loneliness” is a sensational new book about the
Crown Prince Akihito written by a friend and former class¬
mate. It’s causing a furor in Tokyo.
A classmate of the Crown Prince has created quite a stir with
a book charging that the young heir to the Imperial Throne
is a "prisoner of loneliness.” The book entitled K0D0KU NO
HIT0 (Lonely Man) tells of the special conditions which
surrounded the Crown Prince while he was attending school,
of the struggle between students regarding the Crown Prince.
The author is 23 year old Taisuke Fujishima who was
graduated from Gakushuin University and who was a classmate
of the Crown Prince for 10 years. His then©is that the
Crown Prince should be given his youth and be treated more
like a human being.
Life Span of the Japanese is now longer by 14 years.
The life expectancy of the Japanese lengthened by 14 years
in the past 9 years and the death rate remarkably decreased,
the Welfare Ministry noted recently in a White Paper on
population.
According to the paper, the average span of human life for
men is 64 and for women: 68 in 1956. It was 50 and 54
respectively in 1947. This was attributed to the decrease
of tuberculosis, pneumonia and inflamation of the intestines.
Heart disease and hardening of the arteries are not great
killers in Japan.
